main.name: Jacob Makarsky
main.description: Co-Founder of LiveBet, Partner at Digital Wealth Management
main.bio: I enjoy being around people, using my imagination to design & develop software and experimenting with different methods of development. I plan to be a digital nomad; I want to see the world and eventually gain enough equity to help in philanthropy.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to email me for business interests, advice or just to say hello

education.description: Learned software engineering at an educational level, learned 2 years of Chinese, made friends from all over the world and helped lead in the local entrepreneur community.

work.title: Co-Founder
work.description: Designing and developing software (HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, Solidity) for a live peer-to-peer betting platform, helping grow startup through pitch decks, speaking to lawyers, financials, the whole shabang...

work.title: Partner
work.description: Designing and developing front end (React) for a cryptocurrency arbitrage trading software to be licensed online for hedge funds

work.title: Vice President
work.description: Help lead the organization's direction, events, influence and connections.

work.title: Guest Speaker
work.description: Hosted workshops called 'Introduction to Blockchain Development' & 'Introduction to iOS App Development' each with 50+ attendees.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Design & Develop iOS applications using Swift, Xcode and Adobe XD on an as-needed basis

work.title: Blockchain Software Engineering Intern (Shanghai, China)
work.description: Created a smart contract for coin swapping between the NEO blockchain (LRN) and the TRON blockchain (LRT) on an intern team of 2 using Solidity & Javascript, creating startup using blockchain technology and Loopring protocol, design some event posters and social media images. 我爱上海

work.title: App Designer
work.description: I was employed by Cte Learning Incorporated; it was a paid internship where I designed an application for Big Time Grain Company. I regularly pitched the project status of the application through video chat, received feedback and made changes.

testimonials.user: Enough people to keep my ego up
Any friend I have with programming classes that couldn't care less about it and needed help (a.k.a their project done for them)
